member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.SharePointPermission
member.summary: Represents a custom permission that controls the ability to access Microsoft SharePoint Products and Technologies. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.SharePointPermission.#ctor(System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.SharePointPermission.Copy
member.summary: Creates and returns an identical copy of the current permission object.
member.returns: System.Security.IPermission A copy of the current permission object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.SharePointPermission.FromXml(System.Security.SecurityElement)
member.summary: Reconstructs a SharePointPermission object from an XML encoding.
member.param: The XML encoding from which to reconstruct the SharePointPermission.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.SharePointPermission.Intersect(System.Security.IPermission)
member.summary: Returns the logical intersection of two SharePointPermission instances.
member.returns: System.Security.IPermission A new SharePointPermission that represents the intersection of the current instance and the target parameter. If the intersection is empty, the method returns a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.param: The SharePointPermission instance to intersect with the current instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.SharePointPermission.IsSubsetOf(System.Security.IPermission)
member.summary: Determines whether the current permission is a subset of the specified permission.
member.returns: true if the current permission is a subset of the specified permission; otherwise, false.
member.param: A permission that is to be tested for the subset relationship. This permission must be the same type as the current permission.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.SharePointPermission.IsUnrestricted
member.summary: Determines whether the current instance of the permission has unrestricted access to the resources protected by the permission.
member.returns: true if the current permission is unrestricted; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.SharePointPermission.ObjectModel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether use of the SharePoint object model is allowed.
member.returns: true if object model use is allowed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.SharePointPermission.ToXml
member.summary: Creates an XML encoding of the permission object and its current state.
member.returns: System.Security.SecurityElement An XML encoding of the permission object, including any state information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.SharePointPermission.Union(System.Security.IPermission)
member.summary: Creates a permission that is the union of the current permission and the specified permission.
member.returns: System.Security.IPermission A new permission that represents the union of the current permission and the specified permission.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.SharePointPermission.UnsafeSaveOnGet
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether saving to the Microsoft SharePoint Products and Technologies database is allowed during an HTTP-GET request.
member.returns: true if saving to the database on an HTTP-GET request is allowed; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.SharePointPermissionAttribute
member.summary: Allows security actions for SharePointPermission to be applied to code using declarative security. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.SharePointPermissionAttribute.#ctor(System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified SecurityAction.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.SharePointPermissionAttribute.CreatePermission
member.summary: Creates and returns a new SharePointPermission object.
member.returns: System.Security.IPermission A SharePointPermission that corresponds to this attribute.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.SharePointPermissionAttribute.ObjectModel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether use of the Microsoft SharePoint Products and Technologies object model is allowed.
member.returns: true if object model use is allowed; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.SharePointPermissionAttribute.Unrestricted
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether full (unrestricted) permission is declared to the resource protected by the attribute.
member.returns: true if full permission to the protected resource is declared; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.SharePointPermissionAttribute.UnsafeSaveOnGet
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether saving to the Microsoft SharePoint Products and Technologies database is allowed during an HTTP-GET request.
member.returns: true if saving to the SharePoint database on an HTTP-GET request is allowed; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.WebPartPermission
member.summary: Represents a custom permission that controls the ability to access Web Part resources.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.WebPartPermission.#ctor(System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.WebPartPermission.Connections
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether Web Part to Web Part connections are allowed.
member.returns: A Boolean value that is true if Web Part to Web Part connections are allowed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.WebPartPermission.Copy
member.summary: Creates and returns an identical copy of the current permission object.
member.returns: System.Security.IPermission A copy of the current permission object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.WebPartPermission.FromXml(System.Security.SecurityElement)
member.summary: Reconstructs a WebPartPermission from an XML encoding.
member.param: The XML encoding from which to reconstruct the WebPartPermission.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.WebPartPermission.Intersect(System.Security.IPermission)
member.summary: Returns the logical intersection of two WebPartPermission instances.
member.returns: System.Security.IPermission A new WebPartPermission that represents the intersection of the current instance and the parameter. If the intersection is empty, the method returns a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.param: The WebPartPermission to intersect with the current instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.WebPartPermission.IsSubsetOf(System.Security.IPermission)
member.summary: Determines whether the current permission is a subset of the specified permission.
member.returns: A Boolean value that is true if the current permission is a subset of the specified permission; otherwise, false.
member.param: A permission that is to be tested for the subset relationship. This permission must be of the same type as the current permission.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.WebPartPermission.IsUnrestricted
member.summary: Determines whether the current instance of the permission has unrestricted access.
member.returns: A Boolean value that is true if the current permission is unrestricted; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.WebPartPermission.ToXml
member.summary: Creates an XML encoding of the permission object and its current state.
member.returns: System.Security.SecurityElement An XML encoding of the permission object, including any state information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.WebPartPermission.Union(System.Security.IPermission)
member.summary: Creates a permission that is the union of the current permission and the specified permission.
member.returns: System.Security.IPermission A new permission that represents the union of the current permission and the specified permission.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.WebPartPermissionAttribute
member.summary: Allows security actions for the WebPartPermission to be applied to code using declarative security. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.WebPartPermissionAttribute.#ctor(System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class With the specified SecurityAction.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.WebPartPermissionAttribute.Connections
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether Web Part to Web Part connections are allowed.
member.returns: A Boolean value that is true if Web Part to Web Part connections are allowed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.WebPartPermissionAttribute.CreatePermission
member.summary: Creates and returns a new WebPartPermission object.
member.returns: System.Security.IPermission A WebPartPermission that corresponds to this attribute.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.WebPartPermissionAttribute.Unrestricted
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether full (unrestricted) permission is declared to the resource protected by the attribute.
member.returns: A Boolean value that is true if full permission to the protected resource is declared; otherwise, false.
